org.openimaj.vis.general

Interface ItemPlotter<O,Q,I extends Image<Q,I>>

  • Type Parameters:
    O - The type of object to be plotted
    Q - The type of pixel that the image needs to be
    I - The type of image being plotted to
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BarVisualisation, DotPlotVisualisation, ImageThumbnailPlotter, LabelledPointVisualisation, Timeline.TimelineObjectPlotter

    public interface ItemPlotter<O,Q,I extends Image<Q,I>>
    An interface for classes that are able to plot items into a visualisation using an AxesRenderer2D to determine the position.
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void plotObject(I visImage, XYPlotVisualisation.LocatedObject<O> object, AxesRenderer2D<Q,I> renderer)
      Plots a specific object to the visualisation using the AxesRenderer2D to provide the position of the object.
      void renderRestarting()
      Called just before a render of the visualisation is about to start.

    • Method Detail

      • renderRestarting

        void renderRestarting()
        Called just before a render of the visualisation is about to start. This can be used to prepare context objects for the plotObject method.

      • plotObject

        void plotObject(I visImage,
              XYPlotVisualisation.LocatedObject<O> object,
              AxesRenderer2D<Q,I> renderer)
        Plots a specific object to the visualisation using the AxesRenderer2D to provide the position of the object. Should side affect the given image.
        Parameters:
        visImage - The image to draw to
        object - The object
        renderer - The axes renderer
